content.description: <math alttext="H C l, aqueous, plus, H 2 O, liquid, react to produce, H 3 O with a positive one charge, aqueous, plus, C l with a negative one charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: For the dissolution of <math alttext="H C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in water represented above, which of the following pairs includes the Brønsted-Lowry bases?

choices.label: <math alttext="H C l, aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C l with a negative one charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H C l, aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H 3 O with a positive one charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H 2 O, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H 3 O with a positive one charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H 2 O, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C l with a negative one charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="H 2 O, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C l with a negative one charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 1.B: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate both particulate-level and macroscopic- level properties.
